data.title: Terrific Local Theater
data.text: We have attend theatrical productions here for years. It's a small, intimate theater; but, there's not a bad seat. The production quality is almost always amazing. Recently, we've seen old time favorites "Hello,Dolly" and "White Christmas" done superbly. Our 13 year old granddaughter has attend their 3 week Musical Performance camp for the last couple of summers and will attend again this year. Annually, they have a variety of productions in all genre...drama, comedy and musical.

data.title: Watching the play 'Irving Berlin's White Christmas'
data.text: What a great time and the talent was just amazing. A really good place to visit at great prices.It is a good local theater with a good variety of plays, small in size, but with good sound, friendly people and great talent.

data.title: Play today was mediocre
data.text: Not sure who in the newspaper reviewed this show and said it was very good. It was one of the worst shows I have ever seen.  The actors over act their parts. Tried too hard to sound like a Southern person and it didn't work. The name of the play was  Mama won't fly. Fortunately we saw the final performance, saving others from sitting through a very uninteresting three hours.

data.title: Always a good time
data.text: Small theatre, but there is not a bad seat anywhere. Bring a sweater because it can get cold while watching a play. Acoustics are usually very good. Good ticket prices for plays. Theater Arlington offers theater camp for kids and teens. Our son went several years and always enjoyed it.

data.title: Fun afternoon
data.text: Local plays are the best.  I enjoy a Sunday afternoon play with a few of my friends.  Not professional but yet just as entertaining.

data.title: We love this local theater!
data.text: We have never been to a performance here that we have not enjoyed!  The talent here is always exceptional.  We would urge everyone to give this place a try.

data.title: Great local entertainment
data.text:
Don't miss a chance to attend a live country show at this historic theater.  It has recently been awarded status as an Arlington historic landmark.

The local country music talent is incredible and you are bound to enjoy this live show.  

The Saturday night shows are reasonable and a great value, not to mention that most shows go well over two hours.  

The theater is old so  the seating isn't modern and comfortable but it is adequate.

Southstar also books celebrities to perform on Fridays.  Names who have played here in recent months include The Statler Brothers, Lennon Sisters, Johnny Rodriguez, Don Williams, Mickey Gilley, Willie Nelson, just to mention a few.  

Check the shows at www.arlingtonmusichall.com

data.title: Great theatre with quality productions!
data.text: This theatre has it all.  It is quaint, but not too small.  This theatre attracts talent from all over the metroplex, with good reason.  The quality of the productions is great.  Jack Hardaway does most of the set and scenic design, and you will be amazed at what you see on stage.  Wonderful theatre!

data.title: Wonderful shows
data.text: I have been here on more than a few occasions- prices are reasonable, seats are comfortable, & very clean.

data.title: Local Hometown Theater with Lots of Talent
data.text: We have enjoyed many plays of different genre over the years from Theater Arlington.  The Theater does a good job of providing ratings for their various shows because not every show is for everyone.  Both children's and adult's productions are available each season, and special holiday treats are also provided.  The Theater solicits and receives sponsorships from the community and is also generous in giving back to the community through its outreach programs.

data.title: Sara Evans Awesome
data.text: I have not been here in forever. I loved the intimate setting. Felt like we "got to know" the artist. Really good accomodations.

data.title: Nice Theater
data.text: Good place to go when you are looking for a great movie. If you like to walk and walk in doors then that is the place to go.

data.title: Pretty decent
data.text: This is a really cool setup, been awhile since I've been but loved the whole layout and setup.  Seats were comfortable and the show (Anything goes) was great with local talent.

data.title: Best kept secret
data.text: If you like good entertainment and don' like Bass Hall prices this is the place. Seriously, good shows at affordable price.

data.title: Nice local theater with good productions.
data.text: We enjoy going to Theater Arlington.  They put on a good show and the ambience is cozy and intimate.  Well worth your time and money.  We always like to support our local arts!

data.title: Affordable and Fun!
data.text: Have seen 3 shows here now. They have such an awesome program and their love and passion for the theatre is extremely evident. Check the schedule if you're in the area. You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Great place to catch a show for a great price.
data.text: The talent at this little theater is phenomenal.  They always have great shows and for a great price.  This is the most reasonably priced theater in the metroplex and the shows they put on can not be beat.

data.title: Great local entertainment.
data.text: We've had season tickets for a long time.  Especially love the British farces that they have.  Each Christmas they have a holiday show and it's always family oriented.  We prefer the adult plays, but always come out of there totally entertained.

data.title: Try a little culture
data.text: My wife and i attended a play here recently, and realized we had forgotten to seek out a little culture occacionally.  We had been in the "go-out-for-dinner-and -drinks-with-friends" rut for too long, and really enjoyed the production.  Director/manager Todd Hart really does a fine job, expecailly if you can catch him playing a part.  He is very talented and has a great sense of comedic timing!  A great night out.

data.title: nice theater
data.text: this was nice but nothing spectacular.  We've been to better but we've also been to worse.  price is decent so I guess it just depends on what play they are showing and how bad you want to see it
